TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP pictures!

Articles.Content:
What mod? (10 chars)

obviously, BOSS (Bolt On Super Sampling), Bobcat's soviet pack, and AIES for the probe

My first attempt at a 2001 and one look to my space station :-)

http://i.imgur.com/hBffAVI.png

http://i.imgur.com/b2WrIV9.png

I decided to make a trip to the South Polar ice cap of Kerbin, after seeing a

The conifer trees really are there! I never knew about them until the video, and I wanted to check this out for myself.

Edan Kerman in the Evergreen Wilderness (as unofficially named by me).

Secluded Plateau, again named by myself.

The first glimpse of the major ice sheet.

A bit of a bump on the engines, and just like that, the mission ground to a halt. However, Edan knew he could still fly this thing a little further...

The final flag planted on this mission, Edan Point. One of the most stunning locations of the entire flight.

Oh boy, what happened?

So, I now dare someone to say Kerbin isn't beautiful (despite a cripplingly low frame rate).

My most ambitions project of the Zokesian Space Program, the Laythe Exploration Expedition (L.E.E.). It got six men to LLO and two men to Laythe's surface, and served as a Laythe station for five years, and was visited by Orbiter Mk IVs exchanging crew frequently.

The two kerbs who stepped on Laythe's surface rendezvous with an Orbiter Mk IV which took them home safely. The other three in the L.E.E. were station crew members for a year.

Here is a diagram of the ship:

First attempt at a 2001 space station :-)

http://i.imgur.com/b2WrIV9.png
so where you gonna go with that giggle?

so where you gonna go with that giggle?

The first mission will be going to Duna. Can you think of a payload that I can carry with me?
Peter Capalldi's first adventure...
Yup, I think he's gonna be a great Doctor!

My latest SSTO the Falcon XIV Kosmos doing her first successful trip.

Craft file and flight instructions is available in the youtube description for those that want to give here a try.

Many thanks for this, have been after something reasonably small so I can transfer Kerbals to and from my space station.. - Dunno if I will use the cargo bay tho, just as a crew transporter

The first mission will be going to Duna. Can you think of a payload that I can carry with me?

Is the gap in the middle for the payload or another rocomax 64 fuel tank?

How about a nerva-powered spaceplane?

Is the gap in the middle for the payload or another rocomax 64 fuel tank?

How about a nerva-powered spaceplane?

I was actually planning on sending a SSTO to Laythe later. I flew the first mission without a payload.

Many thanks for this, have been after something reasonably small so I can transfer Kerbals to and from my space station.. - Dunno if I will use the cargo bay tho, just as a crew transporter

I would remove the cargo bay to save parts. I built it so it could be done. I can make an updated B version if you want with no doors but that still looks the same.

Someone is in my reserved parking space.

My first interplanetary mission in 0.21 was supposed to be a stripped-down deal. A Duna-return mission with two Kerbals. So stripped down I didn't even include RCS, a flight computer (remote guidance unit), or even a command pod. Just seats. Two seats strapped to a rocket. It went fine until I was about 3,000m above the surface of Duna's northern polar region. The log said a structural failure between the Kerbals and their seats. The lander still landed but without even a computer it might as well be junk.

Many thanks for this, have been after something reasonably small so I can transfer Kerbals to and from my space station.. - Dunno if I will use the cargo bay tho, just as a crew transporter

I have made 4 new versions. The A version that replaces the original. I had made the mistake of placing one structural tank in the rear instead of a fuel tank. Explains why I had to much LOX then anticipated left and to little fuel. So its 700Kg heavier and climbs a 2-3ms slower during the initial 45 degree climb but the extra fuel should be good for a powered landing and also make it possible to use all the LOX as I had intended. It can take of at like 55m/s But it seems to be better to accelerate to at least 80m/s and use the runway as much as posible to build speed to slingshot one self up and use the momentum to maximize the speed during the initial climb.

There are also a B version for Crew transfer with docking port in the nose and its 528 parts so a bit less then the 590 of the stock one so should run smooth if you tweak the Physics settings in game settings as I suggested in the youtube description.

C version is a Tanker so its basically the original but no cargo doors and a docking port added.

Then There is the D version and its basically the same as the C version but the fuel tank is used to increase altitude if on happens to have a space station beyond 400-500km orbit or so.

Dont know if it can leave LKO have not tested. How knows.

In fact I have not tested them but the modifications are so small and around CoM that they should work just fine. But if theres a problem feel free to tell me.

Can get the updated crafts here.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/27196441/SSTOs.zip
Ademone spent some time wheeling out the setpieces for a fancy diorama...
dear god what happened to him?

Okay, you ever want a fast way to ditch a booster? check this out!

thats a pair of small SRB's on the boosters that are firing in retrograde to the rocket shoving the spent boosters away at a great clip!
